name: Capella Marigot Bay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I booked our honeymoon at Marigot Bay through Liberty Travel (in the USA) and we stayed there for 7 days/ 6 nights in mid-May. The short version: great views, big room, pretty good service, decent weather, and we enjoyed it being the off-season.
reviews.title: Great honeymoon, and hope to go back someday

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The long version:
reviews.title: Amazing experience

reviews.text: My prior experience with international vacations is limited to a week in Montreal, and 1.25 years in Japan. While Japan gets warm in summer, it certainly isn't the Caribbean. My wife has been to Cancun, Jamaica, and Costa Rica so I think she was maybe a little less fascinated with the whole tropical nature compared to me. We had decided on St. Lucia early on in trying to plan the Honeymoon. We ended up going to Liberty Travel, and the Marigot Bay Hotel was the only place in St. Lucia they had in their catalog, so we went with it. The price was along what we had already been considering. I wouldn't have thought that mid-May would be the off season, but we were surprised to find that nearly no one was around. Not just the hotel we were at- we just didn’t see that many tourists (except for Sandals, which still had buses of people leaving and going to the airport). Apparently that's because it was right before the rainy season, and the busier season had just ended. We were just fine with that.
reviews.title: Paradise setting. Top Service. Beautiful amenities.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: It doesn't seem that the Marigot Bay area has all too much of a party scene, and there aren't any facilities at the hotel for that sort of thing. Granted, as it was the off season, it was pretty quiet overall in the bay and the hotel, so it may not have been representative of the experience that most people would have there. Still, Rodney bay would probably be a better destination if you're looking for a party.
reviews.title: Ignore harsh reviews - good hotel, good service!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: A quick note on the naming of the place- I don't think it's actually called "Discovery at..." anymore, as it seems that they have mostly transitioned to calling the place simply "Hotel at Marigot Bay". If you tell drivers and pretty much anyone else on the island that you're staying at the Marigot Bay Hotel, they'll know what you're talking about. That said, the branding transition isn't 100% complete, and some of the pool umbrellas and certain other items around there still say Discovery on them. I never asked anyone why they decided to change the name.
reviews.title: Lovely hotel

reviews.text: Beware. This is no 5 star resort. It is a 3 star. It is a marina hotel that is very run down. You can tell they are very short on capital. Decks and wood walkways have not been stained in years. All outside whirlpools are not functioning. Toilet broken in room. Service is very poor. Truly reminds me of a Hampton Inn on a marina. Would never and I mean never recommend this to anyone.
reviews.title: Small leading of the world. What a joke

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The title of my review probably says it all.
reviews.title: Good hotel, probably best on island. Wouldn't go back though.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel was probably the best you could find on the island and nice but not worthy of the "Leading Hotel of the World" distinction. Haven taken a look at the other top-end resorts, I do think this has the best combo of location, food, pool, staff etc.
reviews.title: Needs work

reviews.text: The island was not one, however, I would ever go back to nor recommend. So I guess if you find yourself HAVING to go to St. Lucia, this is the place but otherwise, continue on with your travels elsewhere.
reviews.title: You don't get a good value for a high price - a rip off

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: OVERVIEW
reviews.title: Great value

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I have just returned from The Discovery at Marigot Bay and I would echo all that Jontymot has written in the previous review. We all agreed that the hotel was below the standard that one would expect for 5 star accommodation - the rooms were basic with few toiletries, no mini bar (albeit there was an empty fridge) and totally lacking in those extras that render it 5 star.
reviews.title: A disappointing stay - and definitely not 5 stars

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Some staff were helpful - as my wife is pregnant she was unable to 'scale' the extremely steep hill to our original apartment and this was rectified immediately by relocating us to a marina-view room (thanks to Kevin and Lincoln),although most staff were less than helpful and needed to be asked at least 3 times before doing such simple things as bringing water to the table.
reviews.title: Avoid. This is not a 5* hotel
A Wonderful Stay at a Peaceful remote location! All around excellent.
reviews.text: The advertised beach was nothing more than a dirty strip of sand where you get pestered continually by hawkers trying to sell their wares. To get anywhere you need to take a taxi at huge expense - far in excess of a London taxi cab and the boat excursions, whilst worthwhile are even more expensive.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The food in the hotel was OK but the best restaurant was across the bay at the Rainforest Hideaway - not cheap but well worth the money and we wished that we had found out about this place much earlier in our 10 day stay.
reviews.title: A wonderfully restful, peaceful place with friendly and helpful staff always ready to be of service.

reviews.text: All in all, very disappointing and we are glad to be enjoying the sun back in the UK.
reviews.title: Wonderful, beautiful, amazing and any negative review received is from those who shouldn't leave their own back yard.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: From arrival day to departure, it was truly heavenly. The rooms were gorgeous with a balcony overlooking the marina. The robes added a nice touch to the bamboo inspired decor and the most comfortable bed ever. Concierge was extremely helpful booking a full day excursion to hike the Pitans. A relaxing resort with 2 pools, bars and delightful food. Can't wait to go back!
reviews.title: Phenomenal Experience

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here for a week with some friends. Each of us had a great time relaxing by the pools, hanging out at the bar and watching the sights from our deck. The rooms were great. The rooms were big, the bathrooms huge and the suite area between our rooms allowed us to hang out together while still having our bedroom areas private.
reviews.title: Amazing views and property

reviews.text: The staff are extremely friendly and helpful. Couldn't ask anytime more of them.
reviews.title: No Pressure No Problem

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: And for those of you who can't take a weeks vacation without having to get some work done - I had no problems with connectivity. Strong wireless signal on the entire property, even down by the coffee shop in the marina. I even used my GoogleVoice number to make and take calls, so the signal was strong and consistent.
reviews.title: Delightful people, delicious food in a dream location!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I visited Discovery at Marigot Bay, St. Lucia with my friend over new years. Over all great relaxing trip and hotel!
reviews.title: Beware. This Hotel is not good

description: A sanctuary of elegance and tranquility Discovery at Marigot Bay features spacious rooms, one, two, and three bedroom suites, penthouses, many with plunge pool. Three restaurants, four bars offer casual or exquisite dining. Lapli spa offers massage, beauty therapies and exercise classes. Two pools, on-site watersports shop, beauty shop, beach and shuttle, concierge. Marina village includes delicatessen, bakery, restaurants, bank, clothing store and duty free store.
